content:
Update:

I restored my profile. I created a new app-specific password at Fastmail, then entered it into saved passwords in Thunderbird. Thunderbird still asks for re-authorization and still displays a blank page.

I deleted the account again, disabled setting up new accounts with the account hub, and re-created my account manually. Thunderbird still does not connect to Fastmail. It has crashed twice (still in Macintosh safe mode) during my efforts.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Update

I tried to create a new profile. Thunderbird did not respond when I clicked on about:profiles. I re-started in troubleshooting mode and was able to create a new profile and set up my Fastmail account.

Thunderbird has frozen twice and required me to force quit it. I just updated it from 136.0.1 to 138.0 with the hope that 138.0 will not have these problems. But the evidence suggests that the problem lay in my profile, not in Thunderbird's code. Do profiles become corrupted?

Now, I want badly not to re-set all my settings, including config editor changes. Is it possible to copy settings into the new profile?
creator: mozilla98

content:
It may be easier to start over.


Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: Hebt u het al eens geprobeerd via de webmailinterface van uw provider, via de browser? Als de map rechtstreeks in de accountmap is aangemaakt, blokkeert uw provider wellicht het verwijderen vanuit Thunderbird.
creator: markh2

content:
Contatto telefonico direi di no almeno per quantomi riguarda, questo Ã¨ solo un forum per gli utenti non un supporto tecnico.

Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next
